1102973508152381443.text: 5/ To pull the data, we rely on Jira, Salesforce, Google Analytics and Oracle for things like releases, bookings, website activity and financials and Ubersmith for much of the rest (leads, trials, installs, upgrades, usage, versions, loyalty, lifetime value, tickets, churn, etc).

1102973326178295808.text: 4/ At one company I worked at in the past, we created a metrics project that listed nearly every metric we could think of but predictably was filled out just once before people gave up. Strongly suggest to do whatever you can actually do, keep up with and see useful trends from.

1102973191675412483.text: 3/ Over the years, I’ve found that a lot of companies (whether large, small or somewhere in between) tend to focus too much on financial metrics and not enough on product, customer usage, partner and other metrics. I think it's important to keep the metrics in a good balance.

1102973109068578816.text: 2/ Examples: For Products, we track in one place the # of releases, trials, demos, installs and upgrades plus time since last upgrade. For Usage, we track # of customers, users, customers’ customers, customers’ devices in our system, 4.x version %, loyalty and lifetime value.

1102972913639178242.text: 1/ I thought it might be interesting to share some of the metric areas we use to manage and grow our subscription business and the systems they come from.
